result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle James Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kyle James Taylor is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kyle James Taylor was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 14CM633.
Court dismisses Counts 1 and 3.
Court dismisses 15CM55 and 15CM250.
Defendant to report to Probation no later than 12:00 p.m. June 26, 2015.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 14CM633

miscConds.notes:
Inclusive of costs.
Apply bond on file and refund balance to payor.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Kyle James Taylor appeared. Case called at 10:54. Includes 14CM633, 15CM55, 15CM138. ADA Hartung makes recommendations.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 3  in 14CM633 removing the domestic enhancer and Ct. 2 in 15CM138. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 3 in 14CM633 removing the domestic enhancer and Ct. 2 in 15CM138. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 , 2 in 14CM633 , 15CM55, Ct. 1, 3 in 15CM138 and 15CM250. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders: W/H
On 14CM633
18 months probation concurrent on both cases. 
- Costs $500 (inclusive of costs)
- DE to have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kim A. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent. 
- domestic abuse assessment and any follow through recommended by the agent.
- AODA
On 15CM138 18 months probation concurrent on both cases. 
- Costs $500 (inclusive of costs)
Remaining balance to be returned. 
DE to pay cost of supervision
DE to sign up for probation not later than 12:00 tomorrow.
Left message for Bond Poster. Re: Bond on file. km

Kucinski updates the court, there is no resolution. Atty. Kucinski questions a no abusive order if victim complies with the educational plan of Turning Point. Court will look to amend to no abusive contact if the educational component is satisfied.  Jury trial scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:00 am. Filed by ADA Hartung. km
Nicole Jauguet  15R 004099, 15R 004101 & 15R 004102. eif

** AMENDED **
Per Judge Scott R. Needham 4/27 /15 - NO ABUSIVE CONTACT with K. Anderson

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, K. Anderson.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the courts directive. 


Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Status conference on March 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, K. Anderson.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
